# [[mosquito]]

}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|か|yomi=k}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=か}}. Possibly related to {{m|ja|噛む|tr=kamu||to bite}} or {{m|ja|痒い|tr=kayui||itchy}}, although the ultimate derivation remains unknown.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|か|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK|a=ja-ka.ogg}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|か}}

# [[mosquito]]
#* {{RQ:Shin'yaku Kegonkyō Ongi Shiki|161}}
#*: 蚊蟻 上'''可''' 下音疑 訓安利乃古

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|かあ|yomi=irr}}
Cognate with {{m|ja|蚊|tr=ka}}. Likely pronounced long due to being a single mora. Elongation of single mora words is still seen in the Ōsaka dialect with words like ''teː'' "hand" from ''te''. The 794 quotation is the oldest extant example of a long vowel in Japanese.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|かあ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かあ}}

# [[mosquito]]
#* {{RQ:Shin'yaku Kegonkyō Ongi Shiki|104}}
#*: 蚊蝄䖟蜺 [...] 上二字'''加安'''下二字阿牟
#* {{RQ:Konkōmyō Saishōōkyō Ongi|3 (back)}}
#*: 蚊 '''加阿'''
